qns.timer package¶

Submodules¶

qns.timer.timer module¶

class qns.timer.timer.Timer(start_time, end_time=None, step_time=None, alloc_time=1, name=None)¶

Bases: qns.schedular.entity.Entity

Timer is a virtual entity that triggle a TimerEvent ine-time or periodly.

If both step_time and end_time is not None, the timer will call TimerEvent periodly. Or it will only triggle once at start_time.

There will be a great overhead if every TimerEvent is generated before the simulator runs. Setting an appropriate alloc_time can effectively reduce the initialization time.

Parameters

  • start_time (float) -- The timer's start time in second

  • end_time (float) -- The timer's finish time in second

  • step_time (float) -- The TimerEvent will be called every step_time

  • alloc_time (float) -- The next TimerEvent will be generated and inserted into simulator every alloc_time

  • name (str) -- timer's name

alloc(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶
install(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

This function runs before simulator is started. It is used to inject initial TimerEvent's.

run(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

This function must be overrided to perform specific functions.

Parameters

simulator -- the simulator

Module contents¶

A timer entity that traggle events periodly.
